website_summaries.verdict: Whether you have a small office, a home work space, or just need a versatile machine with numerous capabilities, this Epson WorkForce is a workhorse.
pros: A solid machine that's easy to use and serves as a multi-functional office tool that prints, faxes, scans, and copies
Has wide format and prints quickly
Output tray can also keep up, as it holds 125 sheets
cons: Design is on the bulky side, but if you need an all-in-one printer, you may not mind

customer_reviews.title: This printer is huge.  3 feet of counter top required
customer_reviews.text: Scans 11x17 and prints up to 13x19. And, you can print Photos. down to 3x5 with great quality. Epson's Durabrite ink notoriously plugs nozzles. A CISS (Continuous Ink Supply System) is highly recommended. Make sure you use "dye" ink. I used the XPRO V system and their Dye ink. Way cheaper than Epson ink
customer_reviews.author: James L. Deal

customer_reviews.title: Epson is a downgrade - opinion from a professional printshop.
customer_reviews.text: This replacement printer is just as trash as the first WorkForce we bought. Overall, Epson is not cabaible of making reliable printers. WARNING: printheads malfunction, replacement parts don’t exist, WIFI connectabily doesn’t keep up, and the ink is far beyond more expensive than competitors such as Canon. Good thing we bought the extended warranty, someone’s gotta pay for it! (We stick with Canon, check out the iX and MG series)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... a printer that can be used for high output like in a business
customer_reviews.text: This is supposed to be a printer that can be used for high output like in a business. Well, I am self-employed and am losing a lot of productivity & money as I try to fix issues like jammed paper, empty ink cartridges (it uses ink up like crazy), time & cost to purchase more ink, and restart jobs that don't finish. Also, it can't print two-sided when set to do "high quality" printing which means I have to babysit it in order to put page one papers back in the printer to do side two. Won't consider buying Epson again, rather will return to HP.
customer_reviews.author: Connie

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for sublimation
customer_reviews.text: Bought for sublimation, works great!!!! Top tray fits 13×19 when you remove bracket screws so it hold my 100 sheets of sublimation paper just fine with out having to feed through the top feed behind scanner. Ciss modded sublimation ink tanks mounted fine :) Love and would recomend. Other bad reviews are older and individuals seem weird with what you get for the price!!! I can say this is newer model with slightly differnt design, especially where they redesigned the closure, nothing bad at all!!! Love and would recommend for sublimation, i cannot speak for regular ink jet ink.
customer_reviews.author: $kriLLa S€ratch

customer_reviews.title: Oops what did I get myself into?
customer_reviews.text: There’s a huge learning curve to fully utilize and operate this machine. I would not recommend this printer and regret having purchased it ( I am a computer engineer)
customer_reviews.author: Michael F.

customer_reviews.title: One of the worse printers I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: Where to begin. This printer refuses to work. The error bell rings with almost everything I try to do. There are times that it works and other times it refuses to just print a simple page. The wireless connection refuses to work. The software update continues to ask me to install a fax line. My goodness, the list goes on. There are times the printer will say it cannot connect, then 20 min. later the print will come out. Each day is a new surprise. Buyer beware. I have owned the printer for about a year now and use it for my professional small business. I will not be buying another Epson product after this.
customer_reviews.author: Varley not Farley

customer_reviews.title: EZ to Set Up, Color Is Good, but Ink Consumption Was Unbelievable
customer_reviews.text: Loved the ease of setup and the printer display window is easy to read. But we went through ALL of the small starter cartridges and got four pages printer and the dreaded OUT OF INK locked it down. You can't push it thru when one cartridge is down, it quits printing! So, we bought the XL cartridges in all colors and black and got...wait for it...seven front and back 11 x 17 pages. They were full color, but were not heavily saturated. Sadly, we returned it. I really like the Epson quality, but this ink consumption makes this not feasible for any project we had planned.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy Dannel Vitcak

customer_reviews.title: Great value at a great price
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately we don't have wireless access to use all the features of this printer. We ended up hardwiring it but it works great. We also wanted a scanner that would scan to a thumb drive and this does that. Love the two 500 sheet trays. Two sided printing and two sided scanning works awesome no need to flip the paper to print the other side. 11 X 17 printing and copying will allow us to make some of our own posters. Great options for a reasonable priced printer. We are very pleased with our purchase. It also has fax capabilities but we do not have access in our small country church. Very easy to set up.
customer_reviews.author: Very Pleased

customer_reviews.title: Nice printer with minor inconveniences
customer_reviews.text: Wow, really enjoying this printer. Using it for business: posters, directions, product information, and attention grabbers. Photo quality is very good and the large format gives authenticity to what's printed since I breaks from the ''see it every day'' 8.5x11. Wifi and network printing have been easy except for needing to wake it up to process network jobs. Have had some minor issues with the thumb drive transfer also but nothing that would decrease rating IMO.
customer_reviews.author: Florida family

customer_reviews.title: Huge problem with print nozzle clogging
customer_reviews.text: The printer worked great for a year. After one year the print nozzle got clogged and I could not get it unclogged. I tried to clean it using the cleaning utility on the unit. That didn't work so I then looked up and saw how to manually clean them. I got all of the nozzles to work except the blue and it's completely kaput! I'll have to get a new printer because this printer is out of warranty! It is only out of warranty by a couple of months. I have heard that this is the issue with this type of printer and was hoping it would not happen to me! Not happy with this printer!
customer_reviews.author: C. Nowotarski

customer_reviews.title: Great printer...Epson at its' best!!
customer_reviews.text: Have to say that the printer I received was defective but Epson immediately sent a replacement out and it works perfectly. It is much faster than I expected (even the color printing) and is very neat and clear. I have been using Epson for years.....even bought my own printer for work because of the reliability......and I can't say enough good about the company or this particular printer. Kudos to Epson for replacing the original without any problems and to Amazon for selling them at a reasonable price!! Thank, guys!!!
customer_reviews.author: bilford

customer_reviews.title: I purchased for sublimation and it works perfect!!!
customer_reviews.text: Love love love this printer! I purchased it for sublimation and it works perfect! (purchased takes for sublimation separately) I installed them per instructions and it worked immediately no problems!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Tina Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Prints beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has it all, and the set up is very easy. I had always gone with HP printers, this one has changed my mind forever. I purchased this printer to dedicate it for sublimation printing only and purchased a cis system. The wireless network hooked up by its self! And the two trays are a must if you do t-shirts and larger items for sub. It prints fast, clear, and tells you what to do if the printer needs anything. It’s like a smart printer! Would definately buy again if I had to.
customer_reviews.author: Designfreak

customer_reviews.title: Takes a lot of care and feeding...
customer_reviews.text: I had a 7610 for a about 3 years, and I really liked it. Then one day, it just stopped printing quality images. High and low. I cleaned and aligned heads. I did everything I could find online, but it was done. So, I decided 3 years was pretty good and I stepped up to the 7720. So far, it has been marginal at best. Smeared lines on even the simplest black and white text. I have cleaned the heads 3 times now, just about blowing a full supply of ink. It works for a while, then starts smearing again. I guess for the price, I shouldn't be too particular, but it is a disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: L. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Does not last
customer_reviews.text: I have had one of these and one of the previous model, WF-7710. Both failed within a year with light duty home use; badly streaked text. Deep cleaning of the print head did not fix this problem. I thought about replacing the print head on the WF-7720 (about $80) but decided to junk the printer and try another brand. After the problems with WF-7710 I had hoped that the WF-7720 would be more reliable, but sadly at least mine was not. I do not recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Retired Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: I was excited about this printer but a little hesitant about the set up. I bought it despite some reviews saying it was a difficult set up. To my surprise it wasn’t bad at all. I followed the directions and it took me step by step through the process. Not sure how long it took but less than an hour. So far I’m happy with the printer. I do all air printing and connecting hasn’t been a issue on any of my devices. I haven’t tried larger sheets of paper for printing but I have scanned, copied and faxed and all went smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Mom of 2

customer_reviews.title: Excellent high-volume office printer IF YOU BUY A CISS!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has been the perfect solution for a small office with 8 people. We are pushing its limits, but so far, it has kept up well. Now, you have to be smart about this purchase. I can guarantee that the price I paid is close to or below the cost to manufacture. Their plan is to screw you on ink cartridges. If you buy a cheap CISS (here on Amazon or from the usual scumbags), your cost per page will be <$.01 even with Epson ink! (search for EcoTank ink). Yes, it's somewhat of a PITA, but it's so worth it. Just don't tell Epson.
customer_reviews.author: T. Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer -  Careful with installation
customer_reviews.text: I like the printer, was easy enough to set up. The wireless setup is very straight forward. But,,,, I found that automatically taking all the recommended options, is not good. Automatic ink replenishment, automatic updates, etc., is not good, particularly on smaller PCs. These options suck up the performance of the PC. Then you have to untangle the all the options. I ended up uninstalling the printer and the programs and the program options and starting over. By the way, I have a modern computer with lots of horsepower.
customer_reviews.author: Herman

customer_reviews.title: Print quality is low and sucks up ink like there is no tommorrow.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this printer for 3 years now. I originally bought to give a go at making and printing my own mini graphic novel. NOT ONCE has this printer ever spit out any kind of quality print. I always have glitches and the trouble shooting never fixes them. I do like the wireless printing but even that is hours of pain in the bum sometimes. I would not reccommend buying this printer for the price, it doesn not deliver what it promises. buyer beware
customer_reviews.author: Lucinda Vincent

customer_reviews.title: great printer for my small office
customer_reviews.text: The dual tray 8 1/2 x 11 and 11x17 makes my shop drawings easy to read. It can be set up as a color or B/W printer. it is fast. Fax, copy, scan are all easy to use. if you want to print envelops you need to use the upper tray and not the back feeder. that is the only draw back to this all in one office machine.
customer_reviews.author: Boccaccio

customer_reviews.title: Good unit so far.  Poor support communications.
customer_reviews.text: A very frustrating setup process. Contacted Epson and posted a question on the product page on Amazon about the appropriate USB cable to use. (None came with the unit.) No good answers on Amazon. The Epson tech support person was English-challenged and told me on two different phone calls that a straight USB male x male cord was required. The only USB port is on the front of the printer. After two more -very lengthy- tech support sessions, uninstalls and re-installs, the tech told me that I was using the wrong cord, that a standard USB printer connection was on the side of the unit, under the LAN port. That worked just fine.So far the unit works well.
customer_reviews.author: JohnT-ME

customer_reviews.title: This printer absolutely sucks! Print head clogged and won't print
customer_reviews.text: I'm on my last nerve with this printer, so much so that I decided to come here and warn anyone about this total piece of garbage. Worked fine when I first got it, but rapidly degraded into a a giant paperweight. Print head constantly clogs, printing just looks like crap, color printing looks even worse. A human face looks like a person from Mars. I'm filled with hate using this thing. I just want to print a simple piece of paper. Everything is a hassle with it. My iphone isn't supported so i cant plug it in and print from it. Just crap. Save your money.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela Melnick

customer_reviews.title: Photo copies are poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for photo quality and art/ crafts, not acceptable at all. VERY heavy unit. large footprint also. Documents are fine if you just do that. Trays are a big hassle, they put 'covers' on the trays, you have to remove the whole thing to load more paper. The unit was sent back and at a cost. Do not recommend you buy from the Mega Store. Cost to return and told it would cost 20% restocking if the packaging was not original...etc. Kinda of left that open, I don't know what I will be charged. I did not see any mention of this when I bought it. ???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Epson should be ashamed
customer_reviews.text: Got this for a new satellite office to scan and print (no faxing). Everything about this device is either crippled or it just doesn't work. We think that the overriding design feature of this printer is to bolster Epson ink sales (black cartridge was below half after printing 1 page---the printer test page from the server). Thankfully, it just needs to work until the real scanner and printer arrives (a refurbished HP MFP). At least it was inexpensive.
customer_reviews.author: m_a_s

customer_reviews.title: Very frustrated; wish I could return it!
customer_reviews.text: I have several frustrations with this printer. 1) I can't seem to find a way to manually choose which paper tray it's going to pull from. It wants me to designate what kind of paper is in each tray, then when I go to print, tell it what kind of paper I want to print on. That just doesn't always work right. I'd rather just say "pull from Tray 2" or whatever. 2) The print quality has been less than ideal right from day 1. Color pictures come out with variation lines. 3) Even in B&W, this printer seems to use ink way faster than any other machine I've had. And color?? GONE in SECONDS! Very frustrated.
customer_reviews.author: Sara Oliver

customer_reviews.title: $200 piece of junk!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible...it never printed the print test lines correctly I called epson I think the guy was trying to scam me! He tried to get me to give him my credit card for file completeness ummm no. He said they would send me a new printer never received and when I tried it again something must have broke inside now it just makes a loud noise and won’t print. I have $200 piece of junk! Never buying an epson printer again second time I’ve had an issue with epson printer and they do not stand behind their products. If I could give no stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Hope I have better luck. I have always used epsom workforce printers
customer_reviews.text: I am on my third printer in less than six months. The first printer the black stopped working. Second printer I have only printed about 3000 copies and the blue and yellow quit working. Waiting for my third printer to arrive. Hope I have better luck. I have always used epsom workforce printers. May have to re-think my printer of choice. Not a happy camper
customer_reviews.author: Bob Gebhard

customer_reviews.title: STAY AWAY - COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY
customer_reviews.text: Don't waste your money. This item worked all of ONE week! Of course, I didn't open it and put it together to print until 2 days before the return window either. It's a piece of garbage! Won't even turn on now. Waste of money completely!
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Hill

customer_reviews.title: It's okay
customer_reviews.text: I bought the printer because it prints large format, like posters. Except this model has limited printing capabilities as it does not print on certain size papers. For me it has been bad because I need to print on B4 (10X14) paper size and for the life of me no matter how many times I have used the "user defined" page set up the printer simply will not accept or print that size, making it pretty much useless for what I need it for. The plastic trays feel a little flimsy but you can deal with that. Colors are fine and printing quality is good.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: We have several of these at home and in the office. They are a great throw away printer with pretty good print quality. The best thing is the wide format printing from the 2nd tray. It has some networking limitations. You can't connect directly then share it, so you are either wired or wireless. Print quality is good and relatively fast. Tech support kind of sucks, although I could understand them. There isn't a lot they can do to help...unplug it and plug it back in. If that doesn't help, take it in for service. That's why I consider them throw away...every 3-5 years.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Keep Looking for Something Better
customer_reviews.text: This printer is at first very nice looking. Great for even a small office. But upon daily use to help my daughters with school online, I noticed it only prints when it feels like it. The scan feature doesn't work from the touch screen but it does work from my computer. There is an app to click in your start menu to bring up the scan feature but it doesn't easily make an icon on your desktop. I currently am unable to print on this printer, after restarting both devices and doing an update on the Epson software and trying 2 browsers. I am still unable to print. Garbage!
customer_reviews.author: Jimmy

customer_reviews.title: Horrible!
customer_reviews.text: This printer has NEVER printed properly. It ALWAYS prints like the ink is almost out even after new cartidges are installed. This is using EPSON cartidges not after market ones. Complete waste of money. I have cleaned print heads, done nozzle checks etc. Also it constantly tells me there is a software update but if I choose to update it it just keeps cycling and never actually does the update. I always need to force a power shutdown.
customer_reviews.author: Patti W.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: If using sublimation ink, after changing ink cartidges, initiate clean cycle at least 10-15 times. At first the print will show, that's just the regular ink being purged, then the sublimation ink will slowly get to the print head. YouTube videos are helpful. Great printer. Been using Epsons for years never had a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B.

customer_reviews.title: Worst Printer We Have Purchased. Save Your Money.
customer_reviews.text: This Epson Workforce WF7720 has been the worst printer we have ever purchased! We purchased this printer in March 2018. I was very impressed at first, even though it was big and noisy. However, after about a year problems incurred. I was on phone with tech support for over an hour once about a setup issue, with no resolution and was told to call google for support. It was not a Google issue. Seems there has been one problem after another and now we are left with very expensive ink cartridges we cannot use. Please dont waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: G Simpler

customer_reviews.title: Poor Touch Pad & Complicated Set Up
customer_reviews.text: Printing is excellent. Software and configuration is complicated and difficult. Disk provided with the machine would not install properly. I had to download the driver package from their web site to get everything set up properly. The touch pad on the machine is poor at best. The pull out control panel is not stable and moves when the touch pad is used. Keys on the touch pad must be pressed, or jabbed, 4, 5 or 6 times to get a response. Very frustrating and difficult to use. The next time I need a multi-function printer for my home business, I will look at something other than Epson.
customer_reviews.author: Lionel G.

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I got a lemon? Nope.
customer_reviews.text: Feeders broke after 2 months of use. Customer service for Epson is the absolute worst!!! Get the warranty offered by amazon, you won’t regret it. Update- 5/18/2020 after the second model’s paper Feeder broke, I went thru 3 refurbished printers before they finally sent me one that works. I gave up and bought a second one from amazon in the mean time. Amazon, always great. Epson, not so much.
customer_reviews.author: Robin E. Britton

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Quality
customer_reviews.text: I use this primarily for printing plans on 17'x11" paper. So far it is doing an excellent job.
customer_reviews.author: Cisco Kid

customer_reviews.title: Mines doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: I’ve recived my wf 7720 on Jun 21st. I didn’t use it right away because I had so much going on around that time. Anyways.. It looks nice but it’s way too big for me and I’ve only used it maybe about 5 times just to try different methods to get it to print right, still no good. I waisted my time and money and I really need it for my home business. Wish there was away of getting my money back.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: Will it print?????
customer_reviews.text: I have to say when it actually DOES print it works well. Unfortunately it often does NOT print yet grabs paper over and over again spitting it out blank. Then saying it's jammed when nothing is there. Not sure what other printer out there is better.... do ANY of them actually work?? Very frustrated with the waste of time.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth G

customer_reviews.title: This was a great printer the first time I bought it two years ago...
customer_reviews.text: In the last two years, I've purchased 3 of these printers from Amazon and I've had at least six sent to me (Refurbished piles of dung) from the Epson warranty department. They have gotten progressively worse in terms of hardware malfunctions and print quality. I'm finally breaking down and buying a real printer. I loved it for the first six months but ever since then I've been in a never ending labyrinth of returns, exchanges and customer service phone calls. This last one broke after last than six months. The refurbished one lasted about a week and I'm now moving on from Epson...
customer_reviews.author: HCC

customer_reviews.title: Really Impressed with this All-In-One
customer_reviews.text: This is the best “ not a laser” all-in-one printer I’ve ever owned. It prints fast. It scans fast and I really like the double sided scan feature. The scanning software package is very functional. It will let you scan some pages and then add more pages and then save the document. If you have a mix of double and single sided documents, you scan some (say the double side) add some single side and then more double side to the same file. It beats scanning 100 pages and then deleting the blank pages.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Love it. Purchased this so I could get rid of my Epson Eco-Tank printer.
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Love the print quality. Much better than the Epson Eco-Tank printer. Vivid colors with the Epson 7720. The Eco-Tank color was dull and there were no deep reds, blues or yellows. So Glad I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Kimleon52

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for cardstock and thicker paper
customer_reviews.text: I love my new Epson printer. My main goal was to have a printer that would print cardstock and this one is perfect. It has two paper trays in front so I don't have to keep changing out the paper. There is also a tray in the back for special sizes; great for envelops. The printer is quite big, which was fully disclosed in the information. But I'm not quite sure I was ready the large footprint. Once I got past that, it is perfect. The touchscreen controller is very easy to use. Good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: martha duncan

customer_reviews.title: In 30 Years - Worst Printer I've Owned
customer_reviews.text: Can you say paper jam, again and again? I use high grade paper but that just wastes more money and time. How about won't print from rear feed tray? Or decides on its on volition to use 11x17 paper? Very loud and consumes enormous amounts of ink for mediocre results. At times I just want to toss the darn thing out of my second story window. Save yourself some time and aggravation - look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Jamie Dodson

customer_reviews.title: Copy Cat
customer_reviews.text: Since the start on the Stay at Home order was put into place, my wife needed a printer. She’s a Civil Engineer and needs a printer that prints 11x14 copies and quality pictures for her designs. It was easy to set up and easy to operate with a laptop and my Smartphone. We went through the ink cartridges right away that came with it so I strongly suggest you buy extra ink to us. Overall, we’re very happy with this printer and is WELL WORTH the price.
customer_reviews.author: Lenny Martens

customer_reviews.title: Workforce WF-7720
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a Laser printer earlier and I did my homework, however, i found that you cannot get the dpi x dpi from a laser printer-- You know a picture perfect print. I now get it from my workforce 7720 even on a sheet of heavy bond 13 inch x 19 inch paper! I like the scanner too, a true automatic 2-sided ADF and printing up to 11 inch x 19 inch on both sides, plus you have two trays for your favorite sized paper. If printing on the go is for you, than the WF-7720 will perform that job too using WiFi direct. Thanks Epson.com for an easy setup with my Workforce 7720.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan
customer_reviews.text: Won't let me print in black only (hidden cost) Wants to monitor my use (for my benefit or theirs?)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could give it Z E R O stars bc it doesn’t work. Buyers beware per EPSON they are having a lot of issues with this product per their words. Now epson has charged me again for a product replacements so now I have paid for two Printers and I only have one that doesn’t even work.
customer_reviews.author: Pathall

customer_reviews.title: Black Ink won't print
customer_reviews.text: It worked through the first set of ink that came with the printer. When I changed ink it never printed black again. I tried multiple new Epson black ink replacements. Wasted hours of time. Cleaned the print heads many times. This is my 9th and absolutely last Epson printer. The scanner worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Diane L. Palmquist

customer_reviews.title: Printer has worked flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer in July 2018 and have used it almost daily since. I have combined the use of the wide format printing to make laminated place-mats with photos of the grand-kids. Now I am using it to scan and laminate pages from a US road atlas to use on an upcoming road trip to the west coast. Also great for creating letter sized booklets from InDesign, with each tabloid sheet making 4 pages. Everyone should have a wide format printer for those special projects.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: Great printer!
customer_reviews.text: Use it constantly with home and Business! As 1 review said it is big but that is fine with me. It doesn't suck up the ink! Still using the ink it came with and with any Epson it is easy to use and easy to set up. Love Epson Printers and anyone having problems all I can say I never have. I just wear them out!..lol They usually last me about 5 years and then cheaper to just buy a new one.
customer_reviews.author: GwammaB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: This printer is great. This is my 2nd Epson printer. Converted my first one into a sublimation printer & using this one for regular everyday use & photos. Highly recommend
customer_reviews.author: Francis C. Berg

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, super fast printing
customer_reviews.text: Great experience of install. 10 min at most. Prints from iOS devices like mobile apart from windows and andriod devices. Super smooth. Remote printing is a breeze. Setup of email for scanned documents as well as to send for printing is fast and smooth. Fast printing with fantastic quality. Photo printing is also gorgeous. Just happy. Switched from an older and smaller Epson printer. Able to use cartridges I had left from earlier one too as an added bonus. Very happy. Let us see how it works in terms of ink usage now.
customer_reviews.author: Meister

customer_reviews.title: Not Happy
customer_reviews.text: Had this printer for 5 months & the “nozzle” had issues that avoided printing. Called support & they can send a replacement, however will be a refurbished one - what the hell, Epson?! I literally paid A LOT of money for a refurbished printer! My first & last printer with you!
customer_reviews.author: gnahc

customer_reviews.title: Good overall; terrible document feeder
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this printer for our office. Overall, it's a decent printer. I really like that it has two paper trays to have 2 different sizes (8.5x11 and 11x17) loaded and able to print at any time. It seems to use more ink than previous printers we've had. But my biggest complaint is that it has a terrible document feeder (for the scan feature). If you are hoping to use your all-in-one for scanning multiple-page documents, this is not the machine for you. The automatic feeder jams constantly, even when set to a higher-resolution image, which slows the feed.
customer_reviews.author: A Lockard

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome in many ways.
customer_reviews.text: Got good reviews but I found it to be slow, clunky and not intuitive. The instructions were not that helpful, I had to go online to read the manual. I never could get the auto single feed bypass tray to work. It is also very heavy (40 pounds). The paper trays have a plastic cover which makes adding paper a two or three step job. All in all, I hated it and returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Wysenot

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this "network" printer so I could print from various sources to the printer using wifi but this printer can not find my computer on the network and my computer can not find the printer on the network. Tried switching to a guest network, no luck. I tried resetting the network settings, no luck. Totally unreliable as a wifi printer. The few times I can print something through wifi it can take 20 minutes. I have not tried connecting the printer directly to the computer but that defeats the purpose of a wireless printer. I contacted customer support and I received no reply. If you're looking for a wireless printer, look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: justME

customer_reviews.title: I love this printer.
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. It takes some time to get used to the software but it is worth the effort. They could have made the software more user friendly, but it is what it is. I use it to print music on large pieces of paper. It is perfect for that. Watch out for the tendency to print some pages upside down. I called tech support and they told me the settings to correct that.
customer_reviews.author: Den76426865

customer_reviews.title: Ink Replacement Scam
customer_reviews.text: One of the main reasons for purchasing the WF-7720 was it used the same ink cartridges as the printer it was replacing (WF-3640) which had almost full XL cartridges and I transferred to the WF-7720. However if you do not install the tiny cartridges that come with the printer initially then the printer will never accept them. So either you throw away the full existing cartridges you have or throw away the "Initial" cartridges - both ink you paid Epson good money for. Just another way Epson rips off the end user and forces them to purchase more of its overpriced ink cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: dl

customer_reviews.title: Deceptive and expensive to operate
customer_reviews.text: This product is very deceptive. First off, it will print 13"x 19" which is the ONLY reason I bought it. NOWHERE did it say the 13"x 19" was rear feed (1) page at a time ONLY. Seriously, you can't even add multiple sheets at all. It goes through ink like it has a leak - I've already spent twice the cost of the printer in ink in a few months... Really regretting not going back to HP for a decent 13"x 19" capable printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Try it, you'll like it
customer_reviews.text: I don't know what else you could want in a home based printer and now that the price has decreased $50!!!! I've had it about a month now. Want to use it for my startup business as well as personal stuff. Just think, wireless, duplex printing and up to 13x19 sheet size, scanning and faxing. Handles it all and I hope it lasts FOREVER!!! UPDATE: Aug. 29 and I still love it. Have had no problems or issues (wireless hookup). Notice that the test prints don't turn out so good when you are really low on ink. Change the ink and viola. . . .back in business. Hope it lasts FOREVER!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Yonke II

customer_reviews.title: works great so far
customer_reviews.text: I have only had the printer a few weeks. I have copied & printed document. I have printed photos through wireless and document feed for copies. All functions worked fine. We have used PC and iPad for transmitting photos for printing and all went well. I have compared photo printing with Epson ink and a lower cost ink ( ejet ). The ejet photos look good, so for most printing I can get by at a lower cost with the ejet ink. If I am going to frame a picture, I will use the Epson ink, particularly on and 8x10 or larger. Both looked very good at 4X6.
customer_reviews.author: computer User 99

customer_reviews.title: Failed right out of the box
customer_reviews.text: Against my better judgement I was advised that this printer was a suitable cost effective alternative to other Wide-Format printers. Right out of the box the printer was a complete failure. The printer picks up multiple pages and then leaves pages in the paper path but never registers a paper jam. I do NOT recommend this printer in any way. There may be other features that work well, but the fact that the printer mechanically fails right out of the gate is a deal killer for me.
customer_reviews.author: Levi Hunting

customer_reviews.title: Simple for home office
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for girl friend who needed 11x17 printing. I already have the 3640. The ease to setup on a home network is priceless. Simple print come out fine. Doing detail work with larger files will take longer, ie floor plan with grid pattern but saves time going somewhere to have it printed and fitting that into the day. This is larger but it is necessary in dealing with larger size paper, if anyone doesn't realize this, they may have the wrong expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Zachary N.

customer_reviews.title: Good printer, Scanner missed a couple of documents which makes it useless for my purposes
customer_reviews.text: I am an attorney who purchased this for my home office. It prints well, but during my first scan, it missed several pages, and thus has killed my trust in it. (I did try to scan 50 pages at once which was more then the max... but the scanner doesn't have a guard to prevent you from overloading it like the printer/scanner it replaced).
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan M.

customer_reviews.title: touch screen is small you need t be close to read it and use the choices.  i use a stylus.
customer_reviews.text: i really like speed and versatility. having the two trays allows loading photo and regular paper. have used all the features and various papers with no issues. it is connected wirelessly to network. installation was a breeze, found wifi network, entered password and done. had it for 3 months.
customer_reviews.author: Jayne Lehn

customer_reviews.title: Think before you buy. Must read
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if it's defective product or what but I haven't got it to work yet since an error pops up telling me to remove protective material that may be left in printer. Driving me nuts 😂 The seller directed me to the vendor. The vendor wants to charge for technical support. Wow guys, really?
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Epson printer. The first one I literally ran into the ground. Epson's tech support is fantastic-you actually speak to real people who know how to help you and they don't go away until your problem is solved. The only downside I've found with Epson printers is a tendancy for paper jams. You can take this printer out of the box and be up and running within 30 minutes. Touch screen is easy to navigate. The WF-7720 is a bit large and runs a little noisy-but these are things I will happily accept for having a reliable, easy to use printer.
customer_reviews.author: Silkgirl12

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy  not user friendly
customer_reviews.text: Do Not Buy Horrible product lasted a few months eats paper, paper jams constantly, not using cheap paper either. Not user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Loretta Sowa

customer_reviews.title: Really solid small office printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the second Workforce printer we have owned. The first one lasted many years until we finally wore it out. This one was very easy to set up and is a nice upgrade from the previous printer. I don't know how it will be on ink consumption yet, but the quality of the printing so far is very good.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sherry

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Printer
customer_reviews.text: I brought this in March 2020 and still no glitches. The quality of the prints are very nice and we could print from anywhere in the house by wireless which we love. Set up was no problem. The only thing was I didn't read the measurement and was surprise on the size and weight.
customer_reviews.author: miscbills

customer_reviews.title: Frustrated
customer_reviews.text: Not user friendly like my other printer brands. I have had it over a month and still can’t figure out how to print a 13 x 19 print nor get the correct picture ratio when I print smaller pictures. Frustrated....
customer_reviews.author: Cj

customer_reviews.title: Great for card stock and envelopes as well as regular printing
customer_reviews.text: I replaced my previous Epson WF 3540 with this 7720 and I am pleased. I use it to make cards so I use it a lot for card stock and envelopes as well as regular printing. It does a beautiful job and has wonderful colors. It is very large, larger than I thought so have someone strong to bring it home. Easy to install and Epson support is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Customer with problem

customer_reviews.title: Epson WorkForce WF7720
customer_reviews.text: I am very pleased with my Epson. It provides great quality when printing, copying and scanning. The print screen is not as intuitive; however, does function effectively. The scanning feature is not intuitive as well and I had to contact Technical Support for help which was great.
customer_reviews.author: Gale Miller

customer_reviews.title: Damaged touch screen upon delivery
customer_reviews.text: After unpacking the printer and connecting, realized that I had received product damaged. While it might not seem like much, there has been damage to the touch screen and if I wanted to spend good money on a product that was damaged, I would have purchased a refurbed one. Very disappointed. Too much work to pack up and ship back.
customer_reviews.author: C. Trinity Brito

customer_reviews.title: Technical Issue
customer_reviews.text: Have had this printer 2 weeks. Started off ok. Started printing funny so I checked the ink and then 2 colors wouldn’t read. After much troubleshooting, I found that 2 of the connector csic were broken I’ve been searching for hours and can not find replacements Super frustrated
customer_reviews.author: britt nicole

customer_reviews.title: Epson wont help you
customer_reviews.text: Don’t give this company your money. I’ve tried setting this up, and it only gives me the error message In the photo. No one from epson will reply to my messages. At this point I wouldn’t recommend this printer or any Epson product. Good luck getting any help from them.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Fast and Prints Fantastic.
customer_reviews.text: Printer is much faster than I expected and the print is extremely readable. Uses about the same amount of ink as my previous WF-3620 does but makes up for it in print quality. Love the wide format. Works great with my wife's 12" x 12" paper for scrapbooking. Love this printer so far. Recommend it to all.
customer_reviews.author: Plcmore1

customer_reviews.title: Great printer with lots of features
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to be able to print on 11x17 paper so this was the choice. It was easy to install and works very well. Lots of bells and whistles. What I really like is being able to print from anywhere and from any device.
customer_reviews.author: John A. Thich

customer_reviews.title: Easily the worst printer I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I know finding a really good printer is almost impossible. But this is easily the most frustrating and awful printer I have ever owned. The actual prints are fine, photos are very good. However, this thing jams constantly. It is rare when it prints more than one or two pages before jamming up over and over. No matter what type of paper I use, same thing. Then when it does print, pages sometimes it come out crooked and the paper folded. I tried working with Epson customer service and they were absolutely no help whatsoever. This thing is going in the dumpster.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Maierhauser

customer_reviews.title: No good
customer_reviews.text: Not worth the money, lost of problem with its performance
customer_reviews.author: Bee Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good Overall Printer if a bit slow
customer_reviews.text: It is mostly for personal use, although I do a newsletter on it and appreciate the two-sided printing. However, it is very slow, compared to my last Epson printer. Generally, since I am usually not in a hurry, it's ok. For office use though, this could be a problem. I am an artist so really appreciate the large format printing.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Hauck

customer_reviews.title: Wow this printer is what I need
customer_reviews.text: I love this printer. I did a 13 by 19 inch print out. My Photo came out Great! You can't beat this printer. Scan, Fax and print on both sides. Yes, I love this printer. 2nd Epson printer in a year. I love Epson. You have to buy this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Jimbo

customer_reviews.title: Printer has stopped printing longer documents
customer_reviews.text: At first, I loved this printer. Now, after the warranty has expired, I am not so certain. When I print a multi-page documents, it will print 7 pages (sometimes less), then the 8th page will have 20% printed, and then a completely blank sheet. The printing itself is excellent, it just will not print all pages at once. I have contacted tech support and they reply with canned questions about the quality of the ink cartridges. I do not believe it is the ink - I am using Epson ink. Still waiting for tech support to get back to me.
customer_reviews.author: Terry Warhol, PE

customer_reviews.title: Superior quality copies
customer_reviews.text: This printer puts out superior copies. Very crisp and professional. We also have an Epson tankless printer but this lower priced printer does a much better job. We will continue to use both but this 7720 is our preferred printer
customer_reviews.author: The Edwards

customer_reviews.title: Not for desktops but still awesome printer
customer_reviews.text: There is no way you could have this on your desk in a home office. I have mine on the floor. I should have to buy another printer again. I bought this one because it prints 11x17 (tabloid) and love it.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Simmons

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: This printer is EVERYTHING! Touchscreen, prints vibrant colors and prints in tabloid size! Its definitely what I needed for my growing business. The ink is easy to change as well.
customer_reviews.author: Keila Morton

customer_reviews.title: Good 11x17 dual tray printer scanner for home office.
customer_reviews.text: Good price and features for a small home office. I have a similar older Epson 8x11 two tray model. I wanted a model with 11x17 capabilities and two trays. They both use the same ink cartridges. I use this for a small home office /work at home set up and it works very well. You can save a ton of money by buying third party replacement cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: tesla

customer_reviews.title: Loved it til problem
customer_reviews.text: WF 7720 with ink nozzle failure. Did multiple head cleanings .It’s great until this makes it unusable. Had previous WF with same issue. I love it’s scanning size and touchscreen and 2 trays.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Will Not Print Black when colors are empty
customer_reviews.text: This printer was great until the color cartridges ran out. I barely ever print in Color but the machine "Primes the print head" which uses the colors. With an almost full Black Cartridge i can't print anything because the colors are empty. I called technical support who told me the only way to print is to go buy Color Cartridges. I changed the settings on my PC to grey-scale printing only, but it doesn't help.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Stephenson.

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: This printer has out performed my every expectation. I have printed 2 books on 11x17 cardstock and can not believe how well they came out. I will follow up down the road but highly recommend this printer if you are on the edge of buying.
customer_reviews.author: Richard W.

customer_reviews.title: NOT SUBLIMATION!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased because it is advertised to work with sublimation ink. It does not. Epson tech support informed me that none of the WorkForce printers are sublimation printers. So if that is what you are looking for do not waste your money like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Juju

customer_reviews.title: Does not work with sublimation tank and ink!
customer_reviews.text: Although this is a multi-featured printer - has all the bells and whistles, it was intended for use in sublimation printing. Even with technician's assistance, it would not recognize the sublimation print cartridges. If not able to do so, it should be noted somewhere.
customer_reviews.author: California Okie

customer_reviews.title: After a month and a half I am sending this back
customer_reviews.text: I tried this Epson Workforce because I had paper feed problems with my HP. I had read some reviews and was misled into thinking that this would be better. We ran our first big job and not only did it have feed problems with both paper and label, but it used a ton of ink. I had Instant Ink with HP and I think that I am going to go back to an HP printer because of it - such a better deal. I am hoping this won't be a pain to return. The printer and box are enormous.
customer_reviews.author: Eric K.

customer_reviews.title: Did not last 11 months
customer_reviews.text: The print head clogged and pictures are all green now. changed all print cartridges and ran all self cleaning programs but it's only working for black type now, no pictures or graphs. It's a boat anchor now. I don't think you should buy this model.
customer_reviews.author: 455 pontiac

customer_reviews.title: 2 Ink nozzles did not work
customer_reviews.text: I contacted Epson Tech service and after a short discussion they agreed to Federal Express a new unit which I received 2 days ago. The one that did not work was returned to Epson per their direction via Federal Express. All fine now
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: POS won't print Blank and grayscale unless you have all three colors full
customer_reviews.text: If you have a business do not buy this!!! If you run out of one color it becomes a useless POS!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: charles Lori

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome printer. My husband does civil engineering and needs to print out plans. This works really good for that! Have some squeaking starting in the last couple of weeks. Great though!!
customer_reviews.author: Mary

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this printer
customer_reviews.text: Only had this printer for a couple of weeks and used for ONE job. Print quality mediocre at best. Printed about 100 copies great and then started blurring. After about 200 copies (Same day) the network kept disconnecting in the middle of a job and I had to delete the printer and then reinstall it about 15 times.
customer_reviews.author: MrFalcon62

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: So far, it is working wonderfully. Great print quality. Seems to be using ink at a pretty good rate. I'm surprised the cartridges are so small for this large of a printer. I suppose that Epson can sell more ink this way...
customer_reviews.author: HAT

product_meta.title: Epson WorkForce WF-7720 Wireless Wide-format Color Inkjet Printer with Copy, Scan, Fax, Wi-Fi Direct and Ethernet, Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
product_meta.description: Style:Printer (WF-7720)Powered by Precision Core, the workforce WF-7720 wide-format all-in-one printer quickly produces print-shop-quality borderless prints up to 13" X 19" And scans up to 11" X 17". A versatile inkjet, it features 500-sheet capacity, dual trays, Plus a rear feed for specialty paper, ensuring powerful productivity for any office. It also includes auto 2-sided Print, copy, scan and fax, Plus a 35-page auto document feeder. Use the 4. 3" Color touchscreen for easy navigation and control. Featuring the ultimate in wired and wireless networking, the WF-7720 makes it easy to print from tablets and smartphones), and includes Wi-Fi direct(2), Ethernet and NFC). This Epson printer is designed for use with only genuine Epson-brand cartridges. Other brands of ink cartridges and ink supplies are not compatible and, even if described as Compatible, may not function properly or at all. Epson provides information about the design of the printer on the box and in many other locations and materials Included with the printer and on the website. Epson periodically provides firmware updates to address issues of security, performance, minor bug fixes and ensure the printer functions as designed. This printer was designed to work only with genuine Epson ink cartridges and some updates may affect the functionality of third party ink. Non-Epson branded or Altered Epson cartridges that functioned prior to a firmware update may not continue to function. † Black and color print speeds are measured in accordance with ISO/IEC 24734. Actual print times will vary based on system configuration, software, and page complexity. For more information, visit www. Epsonbination/printspeed1 most features require an Internet connection to the printer, as well as an Internet- and/or email-enabled device. For a list of Epson Connect enabled printers and compatible devices and apps, visit www. Epsonbination/connect2 Wi-Fi certified; level of performance subject to the range of the router being used. Wi-Fi Direct may require printer software. 3 NFC requires use of a device that includes NFC, and may require additional software. 4 Up to 80 percent based on comparing manufacturers’ reported Tec values of the best-selling, A3 color laser printers priced at $999 (USD) or less with print Speeds of 30 ppm or less as of December 2016. Actual power savings will vary by product Model and usage. 5 see our website for convenient and reasonable recycling options at www. Epsonbination/recycle6 smart way is an innovative partnership of the U. S. Environmental Protection Agency that reduces greenhouse gases and other air pollutants and improves fuel efficiency.
feature_bullets: Epson strongly recommends the use of Genuine Epson inks for a quality printing experience. Non Epson inks and inks not formulated for your specific printer may cause damage that is not covered by the Epson warranty.
Get performance beyond laser — the workforce WF-7720, powered by Precision Core

Print-shop quality — borderless prints upto 13" X 19". Operating Syatems - Windows 10 (32-bit, 64-bit), Windows 8/8.1 (32-bit, 64-bit), Windows 7 (32-bit, 64-bit), Windows Vista (32-bit, 64-bit), Windows Server 2003 (SP2) – Windows Server 20167, Mac OS X 10.6.8 – macOS 10.12.x8
Economical — uses upto 80 percent less power vs. Color laser printers (4)
High-volume printing — 500-sheet capacity, dual trays, Plus a rear feed for specialty paper; 125-sheet output tray
Note: This printer is designed for use with Epson cartridges only, not third-party cartridges or ink. See product description for more details
Auto 2-sided Print, copy, scan and fax — Plus 35-page auto document feeder
Easy navigation and control — Intuitive 4. 3" color touchscreen
Ultimate wireless printing and networking — Print from iPad, iPhone, Android tablets and smartphones); Includes Wi-Fi Direct), Ethernet and NFC)
Large scans — easily scan upto 11" X 17" With 2-sided auto document feeder

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.2 out of 5 stars1,121 ratings4.2 out of 5 stars
